definition: to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
(final particle, same as 吧)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited
old variant of 絻[wen4]

sentences.english: He was ousted in a coup two years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他信两年前在一次政变中被罢免。

sentences.english: Members of the standing committee are elected and subject to recall by the congress.
sentences.chinese: 常委会由代表大会选举或者罢免。

sentences.english: The committee deposed him from his office.
sentences.chinese: 委员会罢免了他的职务。

sentences.english: Ru-song li threat XuanZu if not recall yoo sung-ryong, Ming army withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 李如松威胁宣祖如果不罢免柳成龙，明军就撤军。

sentences.english: The council of the tribe also had the power to depose both sachems and chiefs .
sentences.chinese: 部落会议也有罢免首领和酋帅的权利。

sentences.english: The proposal of removal are submitted to the congresses by the presidiums.
sentences.chinese: 罢免案由主席团提请大会审议。

sentences.english: The mayor of Shijiazhuang has been dismissed.
Some others supported the proposal but still thought it improper at this time.
sentences.chinese: 也有人赞成罢免案，但是认为不宜在此时提出。

sentences.english: Lenin emphasizes the election of people and the right that unmake a cadre.
sentences.chinese: 列宁强调人民群众的选举和罢免干部的权利。

sentences.english: The gens deposes the sachem and war-chief at will.
sentences.chinese: 氏族可以任意罢免酋长和酋帅。

sentences.english: The chief method of discovery is deposing of the parties and witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 被发现的，主要手法是罢免当事人和证人。

sentences.english: The membership ejected the chairman for his peremptoriness.
sentences.chinese: 全体成员因为会武断专横而罢免了他的职务。

sentences.english: This form of recall provoked strenuous opposition from conservatives.
sentences.chinese: 罢免权的使用激起保守派的强烈反对。

sentences.english: Shanghai party chief Chen Liangyu sacked for graft is the vox pop.
sentences.chinese: 上海市省委书记陈良宇因贪污而被罢免大振人心。

sentences.english: The voters or the electoral units have the right to recall according to law the deputies they elected.
sentences.chinese: 选民或者选举单位有权依法罢免自己选出的代表。

sentences.english: The prime minister selects cabinet ministers and has the exclusive right to dismiss them.
sentences.chinese: 总理选择内阁大臣，而且也有权利罢免他们。

definition: to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to accuse of misconduct (in official task)/to impeach
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to dismiss and replace (sb)/to replace (sb or sth)
to ask sb to resign from a post
to appoint and dismiss
to depose (a king)
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to deprive/to strip of
to resume a post
to imprison
to appoint
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
reelection/to reelect
